intro: Campanula × fergusonii, commonly known as the blue bell bellflower, is a hybrid perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, sky-blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and attractive foliage.
